snippet: Investment in new buildings and other fixed assets, once a mainstay of the nation’s economy, grew at the second-lowest pace since 2002.
abstract: Chinese Investment in new buildings and other fixed assets, once a mainstay of nation’s economy, grew at the second-lowest pace since 2002; industrial production rose only 8.9 percent in August from year earlier, weakest pace since May 2009; consumers, businesses and debt-burdened local governments are showing little interest in spending.
lead_paragraph: Investment in new buildings and other fixed assets, once a mainstay of the nation’s economy, grew at the second-lowest pace since 2002.

headline.seo: Construction and Real Estate Reveal Problems in China’s Economy
headline.main: Construction and Real Estate Hinder China’s Growth
headline.print_headline: Construction and Real Estate Hinder China’s Growth
